About

Posted on February 20, 2026 at 08:02 PM • Last modified on February 21, 2026 at 05:46 AM

StudyBase is a curated repository of specialized techniques across various academic fields.

Our goal is to distill complex strategies into rapid, review-ready notes. We focus on efficiency, clarity, and rigor—ensuring that every technique shared is both practical and precise.

Mission

  • Efficiency: Techniques that save critical time and mental effort.
  • Clarity: Step-by-step breakdowns of non-intuitive patterns.
  • Rigor: Maintaining precision while prioritizing practical execution.

Participation

We welcome contributions from the community. If you have a technique or a set of notes you’d like to share, follow the academic structure of this project.

How to Contribute

  1. Fork the Project: Fork on GitHub to start your own branch.
  2. Standard Format: Add your topic directory in the appropriate subject folder (e.g., /subjects/math/your-topic-name/index.md).
  3. Submit Review: Open a Pull Request for peer review and integration.

Topic Template

To maintain a professional aesthetic, please use the following frontmatter for new topics:

---
layout: page
title: Your Topic Name
description: A concise summary of the method
category: Algebraic Manipulation
popular: true
---

Guidelines

  • Precision: Use LaTeX for all mathematical expressions: $x^2 + y^2 = z^2$.
  • Structure: Always include a core principle followed by categorized examples.
  • Focus: Keep explanations competition-focused (optimized for speed and intuition).
  • Automation: You don’t need to specify a date; the system automatically retrieves commit times from Git.
